intro: Icacorea standleyana, commonly known as the red velvet tamarind, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant produces pods containing edible seeds that are used in traditional medicine and cuisine. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for landscaping in warm regions.
